title: Is Prince Harry returning to royal duties? Duke of Sussex clarifies
content: Prince Harry appears uninterested in resuming royal duties and is settled in California with good friends. Despite rumors of his return, he seeks advice from old acquaintances as his current situation in the US isn't favorable. He plans a New York trip for charity work, aligning with the UN General Assembly’s High-level Week.
summary: Prince Harry appears uninterested in resuming royal duties and is settled in California with good friends. Despite rumors of his return, he seeks advice from old acquaintances as his current situation in the US isn't favorable. He plans a New York trip for charity work, aligning with the UN General Assembly’s High-level Week.

title: Donald Trump to plead not guilty in revised 2020 election indictment charges
content: Donald Trump will plead not guilty to criminal charges alleging he tried to overturn his 2020 election defeat. His legal team submitted a filing allowing them to enter the plea on his behalf. Despite some modifications in the indictment, the charges remain unchanged, and a court hearing is set for Thursday.
summary: Donald Trump will plead not guilty to criminal charges alleging he tried to overturn his 2020 election defeat. His legal team submitted a filing allowing them to enter the plea on his behalf. Despite some modifications in the indictment, the charges remain unchanged, and a court hearing is set for Thursday.

title: North Korea allegedly executes 30 government officials for flood failures
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is reported to have executed at least 30 officials for their failure to prevent devastating summer floods that killed thousands. The North Korean Central News Agency confirmed Kim's orders for strict punishment. Despite offers of aid from neighboring countries, North Korea has refused assistance.
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is reported to have executed at least 30 officials for their failure to prevent devastating summer floods that killed thousands. The North Korean Central News Agency confirmed Kim's orders for strict punishment. Despite offers of aid from neighboring countries, North Korea has refused assistance.

title: Why China keeps ramming Philippine ships and where that’s headed
content: Tensions in the South China Sea have escalated as China's coast guard clashes with Philippine vessels. The conflict, centered around the Sabina Shoal, has drawn global attention and involves multiple Asian countries. The US, bound by a defense treaty with the Philippines, could be dragged into a direct conflict with China.
summary: Tensions in the South China Sea have escalated as China's coast guard clashes with Philippine vessels. The conflict, centered around the Sabina Shoal, has drawn global attention and involves multiple Asian countries. The US, bound by a defense treaty with the Philippines, could be dragged into a direct conflict with China.

title: 'Wasteful spending': Prince Harry, Meghan Markle's Colombia tour cost revealed
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's four-day visit to Colombia cost the country nearly £45,000, covering security and internal transportation. The couple paid for their own flights and accommodation. The total expenditure, which was Col$244,245,305 (£44,725.14), covered various aspects of the trip, including security and internal transportation throughout the trip. The total cost encompassed an eight-day period from August 12 to 19.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's four-day visit to Colombia cost the country nearly £45,000, covering security and internal transportation. The couple paid for their own flights and accommodation. The total expenditure, which was Col$244,245,305 (£44,725.14), covered various aspects of the trip, including security and internal transportation throughout the trip. The total cost encompassed an eight-day period from August 12 to 19.

title: Woman starts two wildfires to flirt with firefighters
content: A woman from Tripoli, Greece, has been convicted for intentionally setting two wildfires to flirt with firefighters. She received a three-year suspended prison sentence and a €1,000 fine. The fire department quickly controlled the blazes, which is critical given the severe wildfire outbreaks in Greece during August 2024.
summary: A woman from Tripoli, Greece, has been convicted for intentionally setting two wildfires to flirt with firefighters. She received a three-year suspended prison sentence and a €1,000 fine. The fire department quickly controlled the blazes, which is critical given the severe wildfire outbreaks in Greece during August 2024.

title: Female teacher shot dead in Pakistan for refusing marriage proposal
content: A female teacher, aged 40, was fatally shot in front of her father after declining a marriage proposal in Buner, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The suspect escaped. This tragic event highlights an increasing crime trend in Pakistan, including recent 'honour' killings where women were murdered for marrying against their families' wishes.
summary: A female teacher, aged 40, was fatally shot in front of her father after declining a marriage proposal in Buner, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The suspect escaped. This tragic event highlights an increasing crime trend in Pakistan, including recent 'honour' killings where women were murdered for marrying against their families' wishes.

title: 'Doesn’t give a s**t about them': Donald Trump's nephew Fred Trump blasts uncle over military disrespect
content: Fred Trump III, nephew of former US President Donald Trump, criticized his uncle on MSNBC's "Deadline: White House" for lacking empathy towards the military. He highlighted Trump's past remarks about late Senator John McCain and suggested that Trump's indifference to the armed forces is genuine and deeply ingrained, driven by self-interest.
summary: Fred Trump III, nephew of former US President Donald Trump, criticized his uncle on MSNBC's "Deadline: White House" for lacking empathy towards the military. He highlighted Trump's past remarks about late Senator John McCain and suggested that Trump's indifference to the armed forces is genuine and deeply ingrained, driven by self-interest.

title: US elections: Campaign launched to increase participation of Indian-Americans in polls
content: The Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies (FIIDS) has launched the 'Indo American Votes Matter' campaign to increase the policy impact and participation of Indian-American voters in the upcoming US presidential elections. With around 4.5 million Indo-Americans concentrated in key swing states, their votes could significantly influence election outcomes.
summary: The Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies (FIIDS) has launched the 'Indo American Votes Matter' campaign to increase the policy impact and participation of Indian-American voters in the upcoming US presidential elections. With around 4.5 million Indo-Americans concentrated in key swing states, their votes could significantly influence election outcomes.

title: 'Painful to watch': Biden leaves reporters hanging amid question blitz; team Trump shares video
content: President Joe Biden faced criticism for not answering reporters' questions during a recent White House event. After concluding his remarks on the 'Investing in America' agenda, which included job creation and economic growth, he remained silent for a minute while reporters shouted questions. Biden then left the room with his staff without addressing the inquiries.
summary: President Joe Biden faced criticism for not answering reporters' questions during a recent White House event. After concluding his remarks on the 'Investing in America' agenda, which included job creation and economic growth, he remained silent for a minute while reporters shouted questions. Biden then left the room with his staff without addressing the inquiries.

title: 4 Indians killed in Texas crash
content: In Anna city, Texas, four Indians died when their SUV burst into flames following a multi-vehicle crash involving a speeding truck. The victims were Aryan Raghunath Orampati, Farooq Shaik, Lokesh Palacharla, and Darshini Vasudevan. Authorities are conducting DNA fingerprinting to confirm their identities as the bodies were charred beyond recognition.
summary: In Anna city, Texas, four Indians died when their SUV burst into flames following a multi-vehicle crash involving a speeding truck. The victims were Aryan Raghunath Orampati, Farooq Shaik, Lokesh Palacharla, and Darshini Vasudevan. Authorities are conducting DNA fingerprinting to confirm their identities as the bodies were charred beyond recognition.

title: Government reshuffle in Ukraine: Key ministers step down amid conflict with Russia
content: In Ukraine, a significant government reshuffle occurred with key ministers resigning amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. President Zelenskyy aims to fill these positions before his US visit to present a 'victory plan' to President Biden. This reshuffle is crucial for strengthening Ukraine's state institutions during the important autumn season.
summary: In Ukraine, a significant government reshuffle occurred with key ministers resigning amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. President Zelenskyy aims to fill these positions before his US visit to present a 'victory plan' to President Biden. This reshuffle is crucial for strengthening Ukraine's state institutions during the important autumn season.

title: Sharif: Hopeful of bailout approval by IMF board
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Pakistan is actively implementing the IMF's conditions for a $7-billion loan agreement secured in July. The government has introduced measures to enhance tax collection and revenue, including a tax-heavy budget and higher energy tariffs. Sharif expressed optimism about gaining approval from the IMF's executive board.
summary: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Pakistan is actively implementing the IMF's conditions for a $7-billion loan agreement secured in July. The government has introduced measures to enhance tax collection and revenue, including a tax-heavy budget and higher energy tariffs. Sharif expressed optimism about gaining approval from the IMF's executive board.

title: Jailbreak bid leaves 129 dead at Congo prison
Cathay finds 15 planes need engine repairs
Korean staple kimchi faces climate threat
US justice department charges Hamas leaders over deadly October 7 attack on Israel
content: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.
summary: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.

title: 5 children arrested for murder after 80-year-old British-Indian dog walker attacked in park
What's so special about Kamala Harris' tan suit that Obama's didn't have
content: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.
summary: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.

title: Trump says he'd release Jeffrey Epstein files: 'Fortunately, I was not...'
content: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.
summary: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.
